summary: 05/18/1993: Sendero Luminoso (Shining Path) rebels called for and launched a three-day armed strike against the government. In Lima, a car bomb exploded at a crowded market, causing extensive damage but no casualties.
motive: Sendero Luminoso (Shining Path) launched a general strike in protest against the Peruvian government.
addnotes: This was one of 3 related attacks (199305180001,2)
scite1: "Shining Path Launches Armed Strikes with Power Cuts, Three Killings," Agence France Presse, May 18, 1993.
scite2: Monte Hayes, "Rebel Strikes Call Cripples Public Transport, Shuts Business," The Associated Press, May 17, 1993.
